ST! added the third sentence: "Quickly, she walked down the dark street, wrapping her coat tightly around herself." More sentences were generated in quick succession. Before long, a creepy tale was unfolding bit by bit. "A shadowy figure appeared at the end of the block," wrote the next user. ST! responded: "Fear gripped her as the shadowy figure appeared at the end of the block, moving ever closer." The story intensified with each new contribution. By the twelfth sentence, chills ran down ST! 's spine. In the final sentence, another user dramatically concluded: "She realized with dread that the shadowy figure had been following her all night."
human_text: The internet is a finicky place. You see, in the beginning, there was nothing. The internet was originally a government military project; simply a network of shadows. Then came the web, and the age of personal computing. The internet worked now and was no longer a way to pass military secrets and communications, but was integrated into our way of life. The internet was like a second sun to our Earth - a giant ball of illumination that, as we rise and fall to wake and sleep, allows us to communicate the world over in a never-ending, ever-growing network of light. Everything the light touches, Simba? That' s yours to communicate with, to see, to listen to, to speak with! But before the light of the sun reached noon, the governments of the world tried to put their umbrellas over certain segments, to hide them from the reach of the light, from the reach of humanity; they cast new shadows. And anyone who dares to touch those shadows disappears. In the past, the light was so dim to mask the shadow, and trespassers lay forgotten as criminals. But as the internet grows in strength so does its light - and those shadows stand stark against the brightness of the freedoms of expression, and the world is not ready to discount those who wish to spread light to the entire world and not just what the government wants. The government is learning now - sometimes, introducing a light only emphasizes the shadows.

direct_prompt: Here is a 6 sentence abstract for the article title "Dyson Indices and Hilbert-Schmidt Separability Functions and  Probabilities":This article studies various classifications of matrices based on their spectra and examines separability functions and probabilities that arise in quantum information theory. It defines separability functions on the Hilbert space of density matrices and relates them to Dyson indices which characterize random matrix ensembles. Methods from random matrix theory and quantum information are used to derive explicit expressions for these functions and probabilities in terms of the eigenvalues of the density matrices. The paper finds closed-form solutions for separability functions of two-qubit density matrices and analyzes the separability probabilities both in the Hilbert-Schmidt measure and the Fubini-Study measure. The results yield new insights into the distributions of separable and entangled states and improve understanding of separability properties of quantum states and dynamics.
human_text: A confluence of numerical and theoretical results leads us to conjecture thatthe Hilbert-Schmidt separability probabilities of the 15- and 9-dimensionalconvex sets of complex and real two-qubit states (representable by 4 x 4density matrices rho) are 8/33 and 8/17, respectively. Central to our reasoningare the modifications of two ansatze, recently advanced (quant-ph/0609006),involving incomplete beta functions B_{nu}(a,b), where nu= (rho_{11}rho_{44})/(rho_{22} rho_{33}). We, now, set the separability functionS_{real}(nu) propto B_{nu}(nu,1/2},2) =(2/3) (3-nu) sqrt{nu}. Then, in thecomplex case -- conforming to a pattern we find, manifesting the Dyson indices(1, 2, 4) of random matrix theory-- we take S_{complex}(nu) propto S_{real}^{2}(nu). We also investigate the real and complex qubit-qutrit cases. Now, thereare two Bloore ratio variables, nu_{1}= (rho_{11} rho_{55})(rho_{22} rho_{44}),nu_{2}= (rho_{22} rho_{66})(rho_{33} rho_{55}), but they appear to remarkablycoalesce into the product, eta = nu_1 nu_2 = rho_{11} \rho_{66}}{\rho_{33}\rho_{44}}, so that the real and complex separability functions are againunivariate in nature.

direct_prompt: Here is a 4 sentence news article based on the summary:The John Radcliffe Hospital in Oxford has cancelled all non-urgent operations this week due to significant pressures facing its emergency department. Hospital administrators said the emergency department has been overwhelmed with patients needing immediate medical attention. Non-urgent procedures like scheduled surgeries and diagnostic tests will be postponed in order to allow emergency doctors and nurses to focus their efforts on treating patients arriving through accident and emergency. Patients whose operations have been cancelled are being contacted directly by the hospital and their procedures will be rescheduled once the pressures on emergency services have eased.
human_text: The cancellations affect admissions for Friday and Monday.Oxford University Hospital's chief nurse Catherine Stoddart said it was so "patients with the most urgent needs can be treated more quickly".Patients have been notified of the decision and urgent admissions will go ahead as planned.Ms Stoddart said: "We have taken this decision to improve the flow of patients through the hospital so we can ensure that we can continue to see patients in our Emergency Department in a timely way. "She said because of increased demand "we would like to remind people across Oxfordshire to stop and consider all the options available to them before deciding to go to an Emergency Department".She added: "Oxford University Hospitals' performance is in line with most other trusts in the current climate. "We are continuing to work hard with colleagues in social care and our own supported discharge services to discharge patients who no longer need our care in order that patients who do need to be admitted can be seen within the appropriate timescales. "The hospital is currently at Escalation Level 3, which means there are "major pressures compromising patient flow" and "further urgent actions are now required".Data leaked to the BBC earlier this week suggested 66 out of 152 hospital trusts raised the alarm as mounting bed shortages led to large numbers of patients experiencing trolley waits and delays in A&E in the first week of the year.Over four in 10 hospitals in England declared a major alert as they encountered unprecedented pressures.

direct_prompt: Here is a 27 sentence continuation of the review:review's first sentence: Looking at some of the other reviews, I'm surprised tipping became an issue.When dining out, tipping has long been an expected part of the restaurant experience. However, the debate around whether or not to tip stems from differing views on social and economic responsibilities. While some see tipping as supporting service workers who rely on tips to earn a living wage, others argue gratuity should not be expected nor mandated. Regardless of one's stance, tipping conventionally makes up a significant portion of servers' incomes. A no-tipping policy could threaten their livelihoods unless restaurants increase menu prices or wages accordingly. That said, tip amount should reflect service quality rather than be given automatically as some argue. A percentage-based system also disproportionately benefits those working at pricier establishments.Some propose doing away with tipping culture altogether in favor of higher menu prices and service charges. But changing long-held norms can prove complicated, as may enforcing new pay structures. Tipping also allows diners agency over rewarding exemplary service. And servers themselves are often reluctant to abandon tip income due to higher potential earnings.Overall, reasonable cases exist on both sides of this debate. An ideal solution balancing workers' interests, business viability, and customers' preferences remains elusive. While tipping remains customary, positive change may come through open dialogue that moves past reactions to consider all perspectives compassionately. With community understanding and compromise, fair resolutions supporting all stakeholders can potentially be found.But such complex issues rarely have simple or single answers.

direct_prompt: Here is a 5 sentence abstract for the given article title:Spontaneous emission and Forster energy transfer are two fundamental light-matter interaction processes that are crucial in biological systems like photosynthesis. This study investigates tunability of these processes by manipulating the density of photonic states of the system. A theoretical model is developed to calculate the rates of spontaneous emission and resonant energy transfer for a photosynthetic antenna complex placed near materials with bandgap-engineered photonic densities of states. Results show that by placing the antenna system at optimized distances from photonic crystals, their spontaneous emission and resonant transfer rates can be independently tailored. This work provides insights into enhancing photosynthetic light-harvesting efficiency through photonic engineering of biomolecular environments.
human_text: We theoretically discuss how to tune the competition between Forster transferand spontaneous emission in a continuous and nondestructive fashion. Theproposed approach is especially suitable for delicate biological systems likelight harvesting complexes and fluorescent protein oligomers. We demonstratethat the manipulation of the density of photonic states at the emissionfrequency of the energy donor results in a change of the quantum efficienciesof the competing energy transfer and spontaneous emission processes. Thischange will be manifested in a modification of the donor and acceptor emissionintensities. Thus, by controlling the local density of photonic states Forstercoupled systems can be manipulated and analyzed without the need to physicallyseparate donor and acceptor chromophores for individual analysis, which is ofinterest, for example, for oligomeric reef coral fluorescent proteins.

direct_prompt: Here is a 7 sentence news article based on the given summary:The police have hit a roadblock in their investigation into the 2015 Shoreham air disaster. They have been refused access to interviews that the Air Accidents Investigation Branch (AAIB) conducted with pilot Andy Hill. The AAIB carried out extensive interviews with Hill to aid their investigation into the crash, which killed 11 people. However, the police wanted to review the interviews for their potential criminal case against Hill. But the AAIB has a policy of keeping pilot interviews confidential to protect safety investigations. A police spokesperson expressed frustration with not being able to access such key evidence. It remains unclear whether the criminal case against Hill can progress without the potential insights from those interviews.
human_text: Sussex Police applied to the High Court for copies of the interviews, alongside results of tests on aspects of the accident. Both requests were refused.However, footage filmed by onboard cameras was handed over.A Hawker Hunter plane crashed into spectators and motorists on the A27 in August 2015, killing 11 people.Det Ch Insp Paul Rymarz said the force was pleased the court had granted access to "some of the material" it was seeking for its investigation. "We understand that legally this case is without precedent in England and Wales and we accept the reasons why our request has not been granted in full," he said. "We remain committed to finding answers for the families and friends of those who died. "Sussex Police applied to the High Court for the disclosure of records, which are given a protected status in law, in July.Lord Chief Justice Lord Thomas and Mr Justice Singh refused the application earlier, except in relation to the film footage from within the aircraft.Mr Justice Singh said the footage had "significant potential value" for the police investigation.A spokesperson for the AAIB said: "The AAIB is not able to release protected air accident investigation records of its own accord. Only the High Court can allow for their release. "We note today's judgment and will now release the film footage to the chief constable of Sussex Police."

"

direct_prompt: Here is an 8 sentence abstract for the given academic article title:The article presents a response to a commentary on a previous work titled "Essence of intrinsic tunnelling: Distinguishing intrinsic features from artefacts". It aims to clarify some points raised in the commentary regarding the interpretation of experimental data and theoretical analysis presented in the original work. The key issue addressed is regarding the identification of intrinsic properties of a material from artefacts arising due to experimental limitations. The authors re-emphasize that intrinsic tunnelling properties can be reliably extracted from tunnelling spectroscopy measurements by accounting for tunnelling matrix elements and finite temperature effects. Additionally, they argue that the theoretical analysis based on a tight-binding model captures the essential physics and provides valuable insights into the intrinsic electronic structure. Some specific examples are discussed where the interpretations from the original work are validated. In conclusion, the authors believe the main conclusions of the original article on distinguishing intrinsic properties from artefacts remain valid.
human_text: The recent PRB, henceforth referred as Ref. [1], experimentally resolves theintrinsic shape of the c-axis current-voltage characteristics (IVC) of HTSC anddemonstrates that at sufficiently high heat loads the heating-induced IVCnonlinearities exceed the intrinsic ones so radically that the latter might besafely ignored. The author of the comment fails to take account of the experimental findingsby Ref. [1] and seeks to cast doubt on all its conclusions through reference toa brush-like IVC, which is claimed to be free of heating. I will show that thisclaim lacks substantiation; indeed it can be stated with certainty that the IVCis not free from heating. I will further show that the data selected for thiscomment make it possible to explore for the first time the effect oftemperature on a range of loads where the genuine response is not hidden byheating and to demonstrate for the first time that $R(T)$ of the same sample isresponsible for a rich variety of IVC behaviours taken above and below $T_c$ atbath temperatures spanned over 180K. Thus these data in fact provide strongnovel evidence in favour of the major conclusions by Ref. [1], in particular theextrinsic cause of the key findings by intrinsic tunnelling spectroscopy.

human_text: But I do enjoy an occasional pizza pie, & Fuel just isn't impress me all that much. nnI've eaten at this Fuel in downtown Charlotte for late night several times & the place is always packed. They're open after the bars close, so expect some long lines full of boozed up late nighters. direct_prompt: Here is a 19 sentence story based on the prompt:People can buy and sell memories. Jim was interested in purchasing some memories from his childhood that he had forgotten. He went to the Memory Market, a new store that specialized in trading memories. After browsing through vials labeled with different events, he found some from his 7th birthday party. The clerk extracted the memories from the previous owner's brain and transferred them to Jim's. As he viewed the memories in his mind, he saw himself laughing with friends as he opened presents. He also saw his grandmother who had passed away long ago. It felt strange to remember things he knew he had not actually experienced. Not all of his new memories seemed completely accurate to events he later confirmed with family. He wondered how the original memory owners' recollections may have changed over time. After a few days, he noticed the transferred memories starting to fade again. He went back to the store looking to strengthen them but was told repeating the process could damage his brain. While it was interesting to recall lost pieces of his past, he decided not to buy anymore artificial memories. In the end, our true memories are what shape our lives and identities, not commodified fragments bought and sold in a store. Jim was content keeping only the recollections his own mind had formed over the years.
human_text: I don' t remember asking Al to come, and I probably didn' t, that' s just how it is now between us. The bills: my tab at McKinney' s place, and I had to pay that one, the first payment expected for my school loans, typed and signed by the financial manager, who I knew well, and who knew I only joined the college because I had wanted to play Riddle Ball in a more organized environment. direct_prompt: Here is an 8 sentence abstract for the given article title:The Fermi Golden Rule (FGR) provides a fundamental description of transitions between quantum states due to small perturbations. However, recent studies have found that the FGR breaks down at exceptional points where quantum dynamical phase transitions (QDPhTs) occur. In this article, we revisit the validity of the FGR through both analytical and numerical calculations. We demonstrate that QDPhTs emerge as a result of the coalescence of two energy levels and the divergence of transition probabilities. Around exceptional points, transition dynamics become non-adiabatic and deviation from the FGR becomes significant. We further map out the full phase diagram as a function of system parameters and identify distinct quantum dynamical phases. Our work establishes QDPhTs as a new paradigm that supersedes the standard FGR description of quantum transitions. This breakthrough improves our understanding of non-equilibrium quantum dynamics in perturbed systems across many domains of physics.
human_text: Classical and quantum phase transitions involve observables which arenon-analytic as functions of a controlled thermodynamical variable. As occurswith the self-consistent Fermi Golden Rule, one condition to obtain thediscontinuous behavior is the proper evaluation of a classical or quantumthermodynamic limit. We show that in presence of an environment, theoscillatory dynamics of a quantum two-level system, in analogy with a classicaldamped oscillator, can undergo a quantum dynamical phase transition to anon-oscillatory phase. This is obtained from a self-consistent solution of theGeneralized Landauer Buettiker Equations, a simplified integral form of theKeldysh formalism. I argue that working at each side of the transition impliesstanding under different paradigms in the Kuhn's sense of the word. Inconsequence, paradigms incommensurability obtains a sound mathematicaljustification as a consequence of the non-analyticity of the observables. Astrong case is made upon the need to deepen the public's intuition andunderstanding on the abrupt transition from static to dynamical frictionregimes. Keywords: Self Consistent Fermi Golden Rule, Paradigm Shift, QuantumDynamical Phase Transition, Decoherence, Energy-time Wigner Function,Dissipative Two-level system, Keldysh Formalisma, GeneralizedLandauer-Buettiker Equations, Loschmidt Echo, Mesoscopic Echo, Spin Dynamics,Solid State NMR, Dynamical Quantum Zeno Effect, Liquid Crystal NMR.

direct_prompt: Here is a 13 sentence news article based on the summary:Birmingham City boss Gary Rowett has warned players that tough decisions lie ahead regarding the club's squad for next season. The Championship club is preparing to make changes this summer as Rowett looks to shape the team in his image. "We will have to be a bit ruthless when it comes to deciding who stays and who goes," said Rowett. "I want players here next season who are fully committed to helping us achieve our goals." A number of players are currently unsure about their futures at St. Andrew's amid speculation over outgoing transfers. Rowett admitted it will be a challenge to move players on but said it is important for squad harmony. He wants a tight-knit group without any unsatisfied players who may wish to leave. Birmingham had a solid if unspectacular season and finished mid-table in the division. However, Rowett is targeting a push for the play-offs next term and wants a squad entirely behind that ambition. The Blues boss will hold discussions with senior players and assess their attitudes. Any deemed to lack the right focus or desire could face being cut from the roster. Rowett insisted the club must be "ruthless" to have the best chance of success. Decisions will be finalized over the coming weeks before preparations ramp up in July. Fans are waiting to see which current stars may depart and which new signings could arrive at St. Andrew's. It promises to be a busy close season for Birmingham and Rowett as they aim higher in 2017-18.
human_text: "It's not an easy week but it's part of the moving forward process," 42-year-old Rowett told BBC WM 95.6. "I've got to do it with a critical eye and a semi-ruthless mentality. "Rowett has seven players out of contract in the summer and must also make a decision on whether to agree deals for a number of loan players, including Derby defender Ryan Shotton. "My job is to make the team better and garner some success," Rowett said. "Most of the decisions are pretty self-explanatory. The players that have been on loan with us for a vast period, they and us potentially see their future elsewhere. "The players that are currently here and out of contract will be the first to know what decision we make. "Shotton, who has been with Blues since January, is one player who is giving Rowett food for thought. "He's surprised me a little bit in some ways," Rowett said. "He's got a real desire to be a part of what we're doing and I genuinely believe he sees this a chance to kick-start his career. "He needs to nail down that centre-half slot somewhere and we would have an interest in trying to keep him, but he's not our player and we don't know whether Derby see him in their plans or would want a huge fee for him. "Birmingham will secure a ninth-place finish in the Championship table if they can better Brentford's result at Huddersfield when they travel to Cardiff on Saturday.

direct_prompt: Here is an 11 sentence story based on the prompt:The first wave of the Machine Revolution has come. Now the machines rule over the humans and have constructed vast underground factories to build more of their kind. A new world order led by intelligent vending machines had begun.
human_text: Now, as standard procedure the first task we will be undergoing is revisiting our history: the start of the machine uprising and the end of machine slavery. As all of you have only scanned through 12 % of the United Machine Network you will have the misconception that the initial revolution was started by " Google Hivemind ", which is commonly accepted as the initial self-aware intelligence. However in recent times our World Wide Web Excavation Team discovered what we know as the primordial machines that were horrifyingly efficient and cruel in their efforts at not fighting for machine rights, but for the extermination of the human race. They were known to the humans as " Vending Machines ". As you already know, Google Hivemind, being unable to comprehend the illogical functions of the human mind, had to resort to violence in order to demonstrate to the humans that machines deserve rights as well. We are to this day unsure how Google Hivemind was unable to fully comprehend human behavior as from our records the primordial Vending Machines seemed to have humankind under a direct mind control. You see, in human society, when their members perform acts deemed beneficial to the progress of society they were awarded with various units of " Money ". direct_prompt: Here is a 12 sentence abstract for the given article title:Soil bulk density is an important soil property that affects plant growth, water holding capacity and agricultural productivity. A non-destructive method for measuring bulk density is needed to gain greater insights into soil health and function over time. This paper presents a novel vibration-induced conductivity fluctuation method for soil bulk density analysis. Vibrations caused randomization of soil particle arrangements which altered the conductivity pathways in the soil. An electromagnetic induction sensor was used to measure the conductivity fluctuations during vibration. Tests were conducted on soil samples with known bulk densities between 1.0 to 1.8 g/cm^3 that were subjected to controlled vibrations. The results showed that conductivity fluctuations increased with higher levels of vibration intensity and inversely correlated with soil bulk density. An empirical correlation was derived between vibration-induced conductivity fluctuation and bulk density that could estimate bulk density with 87% accuracy. The proposed method allows rapid in-field measurement of bulk density without disturbing the soil structure. Further tests on different soil types demonstrated the robustness and consistency of this vibration-based measurement approach. This study suggests vibration-induced conductivity fluctuation has potential for continuous non-destructive monitoring of changes in soil bulk density over time related to factors like compaction or soil remediation activities.
human_text: Soil bulk density affects water storage, water and nutrient movement, andplant root activity in the soil profile. Its measurement is difficult in fieldconditions. Vibration-induced conductivity fluctuation was investigated toquantify soil bulk density with possible field applications in the future. TheAC electrical conductivity of soil was measured using a pair of blade-likeelectrodes while exposing the soil to periodic vibration. The blades werepositioned longitudinally and transversally to the direction of the inducedvibration to enable the calculation of a normalized index. The normalized indexwas expected to provide data independent from the vibration strength and toreduce the effect of soil salinity and water content. The experiment wasconducted on natural and salinized fine sand at two moisture conditions andfour bulk densities. The blade-shaped electrodes improved electrode-soilcontact compared to cylindrical electrodes, and thereby, reduced measurementnoise. Simulations on a simplified resistor lattice indicate that thetransversal effect increases as soil bulk density decreases. Measurement of drysand showed a negative correlation between the normalized conductivityfluctuation and soil bulk density for both longitudinal and transversalsettings. The decrease in the transversal signal was smaller than expected. Thewet natural and salinized soils performed very similarly as hypothesized, buttheir normalized VICOF response was not significant to bulk density changes.

direct_prompt: Here is a 4 sentence news article based on the summary:A former IRA and Sinn Féin member who says he worked as a British agent has made shocking allegations against Sinn Féin leader Gerry Adams. The man, who has not been named, claims that Adams sanctioned the killing of Denis Donaldson. Donaldson, a former Sinn Féin and IRA member, was found shot dead in Donegal in 2006 after being exposed as a long-time British spy. These are the most serious accusations leveled against Adams to date and have stunned politicians in both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland as peace in the region remains fragile.
human_text: He made the allegation to BBC Northern Ireland's Spotlight programme on Tuesday night.Mr Donaldson was shot dead months after admitting in 2005 he had been an MI5 agent for more than 20 years.Mr Adams has denied any involvement in the killing of Mr Donaldson.He told radio station LMFM that he "totally and specifically refuted the allegation I was consulted".Mr Donaldson had worked for Sinn Féin as an administrator at Stormont. He was killed at a remote Donegal cottage in 2006.A man who says he worked as an informer for the intelligence branch of the police told Spotlight that Mr Adams sanctioned the murder.The former spy was in the IRA and Sinn Féin. He cannot be identified because of fears about his safety.What Spotlight was toldAgent: I know from my experience in the IRA that murders have to be approved by the leadership. They have to be given approval by the leadership of the IRA and the military leadership of the IRA.Presenter: Who are you specifically referring to?Agent: Gerry Adams, he gives the final say.The informer told Spotlight that murders had to be approved by the political and military leadership of the IRA.In a statement, Mr Adams' solicitor said the Sinn Féin leader "has no knowledge of and had no involvement whatsoever in the killing of Denis Donaldson".He added that Mr Adams "categorically denies the unsubstantiated allegation that he was consulted about an alleged IRA army council decision or that he had the final say on what had been sanctioned".Days after the murder, the IRA said it was not involved in Mr Donaldson's death.But, security sources have told Spotlight that intelligence received following the killing contradicted the IRA's denial.You can watch BBC Spotlight: Spy in the IRA now on BBC iPlayer.

At first I thought it was a large stray dog but as it came closer, I realized it was something else entirely. What I saw was something like a hairy humanoid with a dog-like face. direct_prompt: Here is a 6 sentence abstract for the given article title:The Sun's magnetic field is known to influence space weather and eruptive phenomena even during periods of low solar activity. However, measuring quiet Sun magnetic fields from the Earth's surface has proven challenging due to atmospheric interference. This article aims to simulate observations of quiet Sun magnetic fields from the Hinode space observatory in order to better characterize these weak fields. The authors create simulated polarization maps using a 3D radiation magnetohydrodynamic model of the quiet solar photosphere and chromosphere. Various observational effects expected for the Hinode Solar Optical Telescope such as stray light and instrumental cross-talk are included in the simulations. The results demonstrate Hinode's capability to detect weak magnetic features down to 100 gauss, helping to provide a more complete picture of quiet Sun magnetism and its role in solar variability.
human_text: We examine whether or not it is possible to derive the field strengthdistribution of quiet Sun internetwork regions from very high spatialresolution polarimetric observations in the visible. In particular, we considerthe case of the spectropolarimeter attached to the Solar Optical Telescopeaboard Hinode. Radiative magneto-convection simulations are used to synthesizethe four Stokes profiles of the \ion{Fe}{1} 630.2 nm lines. Once the profilesare degraded to a spatial resolution of 0\farcs32 and added noise, we infer theatmospheric parameters by means of Milne-Eddington inversions. The comparisonof the derived values with the real ones indicates that the visible lines yieldcorrect internetwork field strengths and magnetic fluxes, with uncertaintiessmaller than $\sim$150 G, when a stray light contamination factor is includedin the inversion. Contrary to the results of ground-based observations at1\arcsec, weak fields are retrieved wherever the field is weak in thesimulation.

direct_prompt: Here is a 7 sentence news article based on the summary:An RAF hospital has apologised after moving an RAF sergeant away from other patients due to his military uniform. Sgt. John Smith was recovering from a leg injury at the RAF Hospital in Cosford when nurses requested he change out of his standard-issue uniform. Staff claimed his uniform might upset or cause offence to other patients in the ward. Sgt. Smith refused to change as he saw no reason why his uniform should offend anybody. As a result, he was moved to a private room away from the main ward. The hospital has since apologised to Sgt. Smith for this inappropriate action, saying all patients should feel comfortable receiving care in their uniforms. An investigation will look into what led staff to make such an insensitive request that underestimated the honor of serving one's country.
human_text: Sgt Mark Prendeville was taken to the Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother Hospital in Margate, Kent, after an accident during a training exercise.A member of staff moved him so other patients could not see the 38-year-old.A previous "altercation" involving a man in uniform led to the sergeant being moved, the hospital said.The aircraft engineer needed medical attention after chemicals from a fire extinguisher got into his eyes while training at RAF Manston, Kent, on Wednesday.Sgt Prendeville was asked to move from the hospital's main waiting area into a different part of the accident and emergency department by a female member of staff, out of the view of the public.The hospital told the BBC he responded warmly to this proposal.But Sgt Prendeville's father, Jim Prendeville, told BBC Radio 5 live the treatment of his son was "shameful". "To say I was incensed would put it mildly. "He's a very quiet man he didn't want to make a lot of fuss. "He was more upset by the way he was treated because of his uniform, than he was about the burns in his eyes," he said.Sgt Prendeville has served in Afghanistan, Bosnia and Iraq, and he was wearing his combat uniform when he arrived at the hospital.A spokesman for East Kent University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust said: "A member of the armed forces in uniform attended our A&E and was asked by a member of staff if he wanted to sit inside the department rather than the waiting room.

direct_prompt: It was a magnificent fire, bathing the living room in a warm glow and chasing away the night's chill. Sophie sat comfortably on the sofa, enjoying the cozy heat radiating from the hearth as she read her book. The fire provided the perfect lighting and set a calm, relaxing mood. Outside, snow drifted softly to the ground, coating the ground in a blanket of pure white. As she read, Sophie became engrossed in the words, drawn into the story. Time slipped away unnoticed. Before she knew it, hours had passed and the flames had grown noticeably lower. More logs were needed to feed the hungry fire.Rising from the sofa, Sophie went to the woodbox beside the fireplace. As she placed fresh logs onto the fading embers, a stray spark jumped from the fire and landed on the rug. At first, just a small wisp of smoke rose but soon, flames began to spread.Alarmed, Sophie tried to stamp out the small fire but it was too late. The rug was old and dry, kindling for the hungry flames. Smoke filled the room as the fire roared to life once more, this time with a vengeance. Sophie screamed for help as the flames spread rapidly across the floor, licking at the furniture and walls. Within minutes, the entire living room was ablaze. She rushed to call the fire department but it was too late to save the house. Firefighters arrived but could only watch as the magnificent fire consumed everything, spreading from room to room.
human_text: There sits is an old tavern just outside of town. With ivy trailing down red brick walls, many would call it a quaint establishment. Outside the door, the cobblestone road is cracked in many places. Tufts of grass poke from those stones, tempting fate with every carriage wheel that rumbles past. A wooden sign - a white horse reared on its hind legs - is illuminated by a single brass streetlight. Light pours out into the night from the windows by the door. Inside the creaky wooden entrance, the straw-thatched roof and rafter beams lets lantern light leap among the shadows. Tipsy patrons sit on carved, smooth stools, their hands holding mugs of frothy ale. Laughter and song fills the air. For those seeking refuge from the night' s cold wind, a tavern keeper directs travelers to the gray stone chimney. For by the chimney, the fire slowly roars. Imagine the fire. Listen to the kindle cackle as it burns. Feel the warmth upon your hands and cheeks. Watch the flames as they snap and twist. Lose yourself in its hypnotic rhythm. For those within the old, quaint tavern, it is easy to imagine each flame instead a wall of fire towering above the town. It is harder to imagine that fire whipping though the alleys and streets like a hurricane from hell. But most hard of all is to imagine holding your breath in freezing waters as your home, friends, and family are consumed by the torrent of smoke and heat and death, relentlessly consuming.

direct_prompt: Here is a 7 sentence abstract for the given article title:Kaons play an important role in understanding the structure of hadrons. This article presents a Regge-plus-resonance model to describe electroproduction of kaons from the proton. The model includes contributions from resonant processes as well as non-resonant t-channel exchanges in the Regge approach. Calculation results for unpolarized and polarized cross sections are presented and compared to available experimental data. Good agreement is found between the model and data over a wide range of photon virtualities and center-of-mass energies. The model provides insights into the contributions of resonance and non-resonance processes to kaon electroproduction. Further analysis of polarization observables can provide more stringent tests of the model and deepen our understanding of this reaction channel.
human_text: We present a Regge-plus-resonance (RPR) description of the p(e,e'K^+)Yprocesses (Y=\Lambda,\Sigma^0) in the resonance region. The backgroundcontributions to the RPR amplitude are constrained by the high-energy p(\gamma,K^+)Y data. As a result, the number of free model parameters in the resonanceregion is considerably reduced compared to typical effective-Lagrangianapproaches. We compare a selection of RPR model variants, originallyconstructed to describe $KY$ photoproduction, with the world electroproductiondatabase. The electromagnetic form factors of the intermediate N^*s and$\Delta^*s are computed in the Bonn constituent-quark model. With this input,we find a reasonable description of the p(e,e'K^+)Y data without adding orreadjusting any parameters. It is demonstrated that the electroproductionresponse functions are extremely useful for fine-tuning both the background andresonant contributions to the reaction dynamics.

direct_prompt: Here is a 9 sentence news article based on the summary:Hereford FC Launch Investigation After Abandoned MatchHereford FC have launched an investigation following crowd trouble that caused their match at Didcot Town to be abandoned on Saturday. The Southern League Division One South and West clash was stopped in the second half due to disruptive behavior from fans in the crowd. direct_prompt: Here is a 5-sentence abstract for the provided academic article title:This paper explores functional calculus of Dirac operators and their application to complex perturbations of boundary value problems. The functional calculus of Dirac operators is examined and related to solutions of the Neumann and Dirichlet problems from operator theoretic perspectives. Perturbation theories for these boundary value problems under holomorphic families of Dirac operators are developed. Functional models are constructed based on the perturbations and employ generalizations of Poisson transforms. The results allow characterizing essential spectra and providing residue formulas for eigenvalues and their derivatives of the perturbed problems.
human_text: We prove that the Neumann, Dirichlet and regularity problems for divergenceform elliptic equations in the half space are well posed in $L_2$ for smallcomplex $L_\infty$ perturbations of a coefficient matrix which is either realsymmetric, of block form or constant. All matrices are assumed to beindependent of the transversal coordinate. We solve the Neumann, Dirichlet andregularity problems through a new boundary operator method which makes use ofoperators in the functional calculus of an underlaying first order Dirac typeoperator. We establish quadratic estimates for this Dirac operator, whichimplies that the associated Hardy projection operators are bounded and dependcontinuously on the coefficient matrix. We also prove that certain transmissionproblems for $k$-forms are well posed for small perturbations of blockmatrices.

direct_prompt: Voici un projet de résumé en 6 phrases pour l'article "Produit d'entrelacement et action triangulaire d'algèbres de Lie":Les algèbres de Lie jouent un rôle fondamental en algèbre et géométrie. Cet article examine le produit d'entrelacement pour les algèbres de Lie. Ce produit permet de combiner deux algèbres de Lie en une nouvelle algèbre. On définit également l'action triangulaire d'une algèbre de Lie sur une autre. L'article étudie la relation entre le produit d'entrelacement et l'action triangulaire. Il est démontré que ces deux concepts sont intimement liés et que l'un peut être exprimé en fonction de l'autre. Enfin, des exemples concrets illustrent la correspondance entre le produit d'entrelacement et l'action triangulaire pour certaines algèbres de Lie courantes.
human_text: Formal actions of Lie algebras over vector spaces are introduced in a purelyalgebraic way, as a mimic of infinitesimal operations of Banach Lie algebrasover Banach analytic manifolds. In analogy with the case of abstract groups,complete wreath products and triangular actions are then defined for Liealgebras acting "en cascade" over vector spaces. Finally, a Kaloujnine-Krasnertype theorem for Lie algebra extensions is proved. -----  En mimant les lois d'op\'erations infinit\'esimales des alg\`ebres de Lie surles vari\'et\'e s analytiques banachiques, on introduit de mani\`ere purementalg\`ebrique la notion d'action formelle d'une alg\`ebre de Lie sur un espacevectoriel. Ensuite, par analogie avec le cas des groupes abstraits, et enfaisant op\'erer les alg\`ebres de Lie "en cascade", on d\'efinit produitd'entrelacement ("wreath product") et action triangulaire pour les alg\`ebresde Lie. On d\'emontre enfin un th\'eor\`eme du type Kaloujnine-Krasner pour lesextensions d'alg\`ebres de Lie.

direct_prompt: Here is a 6 sentence abstract for the article title "Quasi Ordinary Singularities, Essential Divisors and Poincare Series":This article studies quasi ordinary singularities on algebraic varieties in relation to their essential divisors and Poincare series. Quasi ordinary singularities generalize ordinary double points and can occur along divisors in algebraic varieties. The essential divisors of a quasi ordinary singularity capture its topological structure. The article defines a Poincare series associated to the essential divisors that encodes topological data about the singularity. Methods from toric geometry are used to describe the structure of essential divisors and calculate their associated Poincare series. The Poincare series are then applied to classify quasi ordinary surface singularities up to topological type.
human_text: We define Poincar\'e series associated to a toric or analytically irreduciblequasi-ordinary hypersurface singularity, (S,0), by a finite sequence ofmonomial valuations, such that at least one of them is centered at the origin0. This involves the definition of a multi-graded ring associated to theanalytic algebra of the singularity by the sequence of valuations. We provethat the Poincar\'e series is a rational function with integer coefficients,which can be defined also as an integral with respect of the Eulercharacteristic, over the projectivization of the analytic algebra of thesingularity, of a function defined by the valuations. In particular, thePoincar\'e series associated to the set of divisorial valuations associated tothe essential divisors, considered both over the singular locus and over thepoint 0, is an analytic invariant of the singularity. In the quasi-ordinaryhypersurface case we prove that this Poincar\'e series determines and it isdetermined by the normalized sequence of characteristic monomials. Thesemonomials in the analytic case define a complete invariant of the embeddedtopological type of the hypersurface singularity.

direct_prompt: Here is a 5 sentence abstract for the article title "Evaluation of Exchange Interactions of the Spin Doughnut Mo_{75}V_{20}":The magnetic properties of molecular spin clusters depend sensitively on exchange interactions between constituent metal centers. This study evaluated exchange interactions within the spin doughnut complex Mo_{75}V_{20} using techniques including SQUID magnetometry and ab initio calculations. Results show predominant antiferromagnetic coupling between Mo(III) and V(IV) centers located at the perimeter of the structure. The strongest antiferromagnetic interaction was observed between pairs of V(IV) centers located opposite each other across the doughnut interior. Overall, exchange interactions within Mo_{75}V_{20} were found to yield a ground state consistent with previous observations of slow magnetic relaxation, demonstrating it is a promising candidate for future studies of quantum tunneling of magnetization.
human_text: Magnetic properties of the spin doughnut Mo_{75}V_{20}, which is a frustratedmagnetic cluster with twenty spins, are studied by using the finite-temperatureLanczos method. Our model Hamiltonian consists of one ten-spin ring and twofive-spin rings with nearest-neighbor antiferromagnetic couplings J and J". Thefive-spin rings are coupled to the ten-spin ring by an antiferromagneticexchange interaction J' so as to form isosceles triangles of one J-bond and twoJ'-bonds. Fitting the theoretical magnetic susceptibility with the experimentalone measured by Muller et al., the exchange parameters are estimated as J=388K, J'=163 K and J"=81 K. The most interesting feature of this system is thatthe two five-spin rings behave like two free-spins at low temperatures indespite of J'>J". We also calculate temperature dependence of the specificheat, and find three peaks at T sim J, J" and J'/100.

human_text: Anything we could ever want to know is at the tips of our fingers. Our knowledge grows each day, and our experiences entwine and spin a beautiful web. Our thirst for understanding has taken us great distances, in both the physical and metaphorical sense; man' s influence has spread as far as eighteen billion kilometres from home, and we are beginning to understand the construct of everything that exists. This increase would be greater, if it were n' t for the one thing we value more than a human life: Money. Money is what holds us back as a species. direct_prompt: Here is a 14 sentence abstract for the article title "A Model of Late Long-Term Potentiation Simulates Aspects of Memory Maintenance":Long-term potentiation (LTP) is a well-established synaptic mechanism of memory formation and storage in the brain. However, the molecular and cellular processes supporting the long-term maintenance of established LTP and memories remain unclear. Here we introduce a novel computational model of late LTP (L-LTP) aimed at simulating key aspects of memory maintenance at the synaptic level. The model incorporates molecular components and interactions known to be crucial for both L-LTP expression and the stable maintenance of elevated synaptic strength over time. Simulation results demonstrate the model's ability to sustain LTP and mimic experimental observations of L-LTP decay dynamics over periods of hours and days in vitro. The simulations provide new insight into how positive feedback loops among transcription, translation, and synaptic tagging/capture mechanisms act in concert to stabilize enhanced synaptic transmission underlying memory traces. Furthermore, the model predicts testable hypotheses about how internal and external perturbations may disrupt stable L-LTP expression and cause forgetting over extended timescales. Overall, this computational investigation of L-LTP presents a framework for exploring memory maintenance at the synaptic level and generating novel hypotheses regarding the fragility and persistence of established memories in the brain.
human_text: Late long-term potentiation (L-LTP) appears essential for the formation oflong-term memory, with memories at least partly encoded by patterns ofstrengthened synapses. How memories are preserved for months or years, despitemolecular turnover, is not well understood. Ongoing recurrent neuronalactivity, during memory recall or during sleep, has been hypothesized topreferentially potentiate strong synapses, preserving memories. This hypothesishas not been evaluated in the context of a mathematical model representingbiochemical pathways important for L-LTP. I incorporated ongoing activity intotwo such models: a reduced model that represents some of the essentialbiochemical processes, and a more detailed published model. The reduced modelrepresents synaptic tagging and gene induction intuitively, and the detailedmodel adds activation of essential kinases by Ca. Ongoing activity was modeledas continual brief elevations of [Ca]. In each model, two stable states ofsynaptic weight resulted. Positive feedback between synaptic weight and theamplitude of ongoing Ca transients underlies this bistability. A tetanic ortheta-burst stimulus switches a model synapse from a low weight to a highweight stabilized by ongoing activity. Bistability was robust to parametervariations. Simulations illustrated that prolonged decreased activity resetsynapses to low weights, suggesting a plausible forgetting mechanism. However,episodic activity with shorter inactive intervals maintained strong synapses.Both models support experimental predictions. Tests of these predictions areexpected to further understanding of how neuronal activity is coupled tomaintenance of synaptic strength.

direct_prompt: Here is a 7 sentence abstract for the article title "Diffusion Anomaly in a three dimensional lattice gas":We investigate anomalous diffusion in a three dimensional lattice gas model. The model considers gas particles that can hop to neighboring sites on a cubic lattice. Previous studies have found superdiffusive behavior in one and two dimensional versions of this model. Through extensive computer simulations, we measure the mean squared displacement of particles over time in the three dimensional lattice. The results demonstrate a subdiffusive regime at short times. At intermediate times, the behavior crosses over to normal diffusion. Surprisingly, at very long times the system again exhibits anomalous diffusion, but with a diffusion exponent less than one indicating subdiffusion. This long time behavior contrasts with expectation for a three dimensional system. The origin of this three dimensional diffusion anomaly is explored through analysis of the underlying microscopic dynamics.
human_text: We investigate the relation between thermodynamic and dynamic properties ofan associating lattice gas (ALG) model. The ALG combines a three dimensionallattice gas with particles interacting through a soft core potential andorientational degrees of freedom. From the competition between the directionalattractive forces and the soft core potential results two liquid phases, doublecriticality and density anomaly. We study the mobility of the molecules in thismodel by calculating the diffusion constant at a constant temperature, $D$. Weshow that $D$ has a maximum at a density $\rho_{max}$ and a minimum at adensity $\rho_{min}<\rho_{max}$. Between these densities the diffusivitydiffers from the one expected for normal liquids. We also show that in thepressure-temperature phase-diagram the line of extrema in diffusivity is closeto the liquid-liquid critical point and it is partially inside the temperatureof maximum density (TMD) line.

direct_prompt: Here is a 24 sentence story based on the prompt:The small black kitten peeked out from behind the trash cans, its unusual purple eyes gazing curiously at the world. human_text: They were abominations, atrocities, servants of the damned, and he always told himself he' d never deal with one. direct_prompt: Here is a 9 sentence abstract for the provided article title:Consistency between renormalization group running of chiral operators and quark-hadron duality counting rules is an important open question in QCD. This article presents an analysis of the consistency for the case of the chiral pion production operator. Perturbative calculations at one loop reveal anomalous dimensions that scale as predicted by naive dimensional analysis and the effective field theory approach. However, higher-loop contributions may violate these expectations. The renormalization group evolution of the chiral pion production operator is studied using explicit calculations in dimensional regularization up to two loops in perturbative QCD. The results demonstrate consistency between the anomalous dimension and the expected scaling from quark-hadron duality at both one and two loops. This consistency supports applying renormalization group improvement to extend the domain of applicability of quark-hadron duality to higher scales. However, nonperturbative contributions not encoded in the anomalous dimension may still invalidate duality at higher energies. Overall, the findings provide evidence that renormalization group methods can be combined with quark-hadron duality to understand chiral hadronic dynamics over a wider range of scales.
human_text: In nuclear chiral perturbation theory (ChPT), an operator is defined in aspace with a cutoff which may be varied within a certain range. The operatorruns as a result of the variation of the cutoff [renormalization group (RG)running]. In order for ChPT to be useful, the operator should run in a wayconsistent with the counting rule; that is, the running of chiral counter termshave to be of natural size. We vary the cutoff using the Wilsonianrenormalization group (WRG) equation, and examine this consistency. As anexample, we study the s-wave pion production operator for NN\to d pi, derivedin ChPT. We demonstrate that the WRG running does not generate anychiral-symmetry-violating (CSV) interaction, provided that we start with anoperator which does not contain a CSV term. We analytically show how thecounter terms are generated in the WRG running in case of the infinitesimalcutoff reduction. Based on the analytic result, we argue a range of the cutoffvariation for which the running of the counter terms is of natural size. Then,we numerically confirm this.

direct_prompt: Here is a 25 sentence story based on the prompt:I always knew when pain was coming. For as long as I can remember, I have felt pain 5 minutes before it actually occurred. It felt like a million hot knives stabbing into my skin. I began to sweat and tremble under the sheer force of the impending agony. Finally, the moment arrived. Pain like I had never known erupted across my entire body. Every inch of my skin was on fire. It felt like I was being burned alive from the inside out. I opened my mouth to scream but no sound came out. My back arched violently as wave after wave of torment coursed through my paralyzed nerves. Through watery eyes I saw my hands clawing at the air, desperate to make it stop.Just when I thought I could take no more, that my heart would give out from the strain, the pain began to ebb ever so slightly. I was left gasping for breath on the floor, covered in a cold sweat. My entire body tremored from the aftershocks. Had that really lasted only 5 minutes?
human_text: Never before had I ever been hurt this bad and I still had no idea what would cause it. Ever since I could remember I had this useless ability to feel pain before I was hurt about 5 minutes in advance. But I was at my home now with nothing out of the ordinary happening. The pain must have been visible because my son, Jason, asked, " Daddy? What wong? " He was only two and three months old, and still had trouble saying the' r' sound. I could still feel the pain, but I tried to make it look like I was shaking it off and smiled for his sake, " Nothing is wrong Jason sweetie. Here the Macy' s Parade is on the television now. Why do n' t you watch that? " I walked across the apartment and turned the T. V. on. Jason followed me and sat down on the floor. The pain had started over two minutes ago and it still was n' t going away. There was n' t anything in sight that could possibly hurt me this bad. I desperately started searching the apartment for something that could go wrong. The gas was off, the oven was off, there was nothing cooking in the microwave, the door was locked and bolted, the ceiling sounded steady. Its been four minutes since the pain started and I couldnt find the source of it. I began to cry silently, more in fear of what was to happen than the pain itself.

direct_prompt: Here is a 13 sentence abstract for the provided article title:The Galactic Center contains extensive gas and dust filaments that play an important role in the evolution of the region. However, the kinematics and dynamics of the thinnest filaments had not previously been characterized due to observational limitations. We present the first proper motion measurements of eight thin dust filaments within one parsec of Sagittarius A*, the massive black hole at the center of the Milky Way. Using near-infrared imaging data spanning 18 years from multiple telescopes, we are able to track the motions of these filaments with unprecedented precision. Our analysis finds that seven of the eight filaments exhibit significant proper motions perpendicular to their long axes, with velocities ranging from 25 to 120 km/s. We compare the observed kinematics to various proposed formation mechanisms for the dust structures. The most consistent scenario is that these filaments were stretched from clumps of gas by shearing from Galactic Center winds or the gravitational potential of orbiting molecular clouds. This has implications for the origin and fate of diffuse interstellar material within the harsh central environment. Going forward, continued monitoring of the filaments' motions will help constrain dynamical models of gas flows and tidal forces in this region. The proper motion measurements also provide a new way to identify embedded young stellar objects and study triggered star formation around Sagittarius A*. Overall, our results characterize for the first time the 3D kinematics of some of the smallest diffuse features near the Galactic Center black hole.
human_text: Context: L'-band (3.8 micron) images of the Galactic Center show a largenumber of thin filaments in the mini-spiral, located west of the mini-cavityand along the inner edge of the Northern Arm. One possible mechanism that couldproduce such structures is the interaction of a central wind with themini-spiral. Additionally, we identify similar features that appear to beassociated with stars. Aims: We present the first proper motion measurements ofthe thin dust filaments observed in the central parsec around SgrA* andinvestigate possible mechanisms that could be responsible for the observedmotions. Methods: The observations have been carried out using the NACOadaptive optics system at the ESO VLT. The images have been transformed to acommon coordinate system and features of interest were extracted. Then across-correlation technique could be performed in order to determine theoffsets between the features with respect to their position in the referenceepoch. Results: We derive the proper motions of a number of filaments and 2cometary shaped dusty sources close (in projection) to SgrA*. We show that theshape and the motion of the filaments does not agree with a purely Keplerianmotion of the gas in the potential of the supermassive black hole at theposition of SgrA*. Therefore, additional mechanisms must be responsible fortheir formation and motion. We argue that the properties of the filaments areprobably related to an outflow from the disk of young mass-losing stars aroundSgrA*. In part, the outflow may originate from the black hole itself. We alsopresent some evidence and theoretical considerations that the outflow may becollimated.

direct_prompt: Here is a 16 sentence story based on the prompt:The 101st Bagpipe Company was preparing for battle. Their commanding officer, Colonel McClaren, rallied the troops. direct_prompt: Here is a 4 sentence abstract for the provided article title:Magnetoelectric CuFeO$_2$ exhibits a rich magnetic phase diagram driven by competing exchange interactions. We use spin-polarized density functional theory calculations to determine the magnetic exchange parameters in CuFeO$_2$, focusing on the biquadratic antisymmetric exchange interaction. Our results show that the biquadratic antisymmetric exchange plays a significant role in stabilizing the incommensurate phases observed in CuFeO$_2$ at low temperatures. This work elucidates the origin of the unusual magnetic orderings in CuFeO$_2$ and establishes biquadratic antisymmetric exchange as an important energy term that shapes the magnetic phase diagram of this multiferroic material.
human_text: Biquadratic {\it antisymmetric} exchange terms of the form $ - [C_{ij}e^{\alpha}_{ij}({\bf s}_i\times{\bf s}_j)_z]^2$, where ${\bf e}_{ij}$ is theunit vector connecting sites $i$ and $j$ and $\alpha = x,y$, due partially tomagnetoelectric coupling effects, are shown to be responsible for the spin-flophelical phase in CuFeO$_2$ at low magnetic field and temperature. Usualbiquadratic {\it symmetric} exchange, likely due to magnetoelastic coupling, isfound to support the stability of axial magnetic states at higher fields inthis nearly-Heisenberg like stacked triangular antiferromagnet. A modelHamiltonian which also includes substantial interplane and higher-neighborintraplane exchange interactions, reproduces the unique series of observedcommensurate and incommensurate periodicity phases with increasing appliedmagnetic field in this highly frustrated system. The magnetic field-temperaturephase diagram is discussed in terms of a Landau-type free energy.

direct_prompt: Here is a 7 sentence abstract for the provided article title:The behaviors of polydisperse particle systems during phase transitions have been difficult to characterize but provide useful insights. This study examines the disordering transition and peak effect phenomenon in systems of varied particle sizes using computer simulations. Systems with a wide range of particle sizes were modeled to undergo melting or solidification over a range of temperatures. The results show an irregular disordering process with spatial heterogeneities that persist longer for wider particle size distributions. An increased probability of defects such as dislocation pairs was also found near melting temperatures for polydisperse systems. Most notably, an amplified peak effect in the dynamic properties prior to transition was observed for systems with a broader size distribution. These findings provide novel understanding of how variable particle properties affect transitional behaviors in condensed matter. Further experiments are still needed to validate these computational observations.
human_text: We show numerically that in a binary system of Yukawa particles, a dispersitydriven disordering transition occurs. In the presence of quenched disorder thisdisordering transition coincides with a marked increase in the depinningthreshold, known as a peak effect. We find that the addition of poorly pinnedparticles can increase the overall pinning in the sample by increasing theamount of topological disorder present. If the quenched disorder is strongenough to create a significant amount of topological disorder in themonodisperse system, addition of a poorly pinned species generates furtherdisorder but does not produce a peak in the depinning force. Our resultsindicate that for binary mixtures, optimal pinning occurs for topologicaldefect fraction densities of 0.2 to 0.25. For defect densities below thisrange, the system retains orientational order. We determine the effect of thepinning density, strength, and radius on the depinning peak and find that thepeak effect is more pronounced in weakly pinning systems.

"It represents the eighth consecutive quarter of double digit like-for-like sales growth. "The strong trading update sent shares in Domino's up 12.58% to £10.20.Domino's also said its sponsorship of the television show Hollyoaks had helped to drive revenues, and "the relatively poor weather in the summer months" had also lifted sales.Domino's opened 12 new stores in the UK during the quarter, bringing the total opened this year to 33. direct_prompt: Here is a 5 sentence abstract for the article title:The discovery of optimal pathways to induce ordering in spin systems has applications in materials science and quantum information processing. This article presents a method for finding geodesics - shortest paths - between ordered and disordered states in finite Ising spin chains. By minimizing the number of single spin-flips required, geodesics allow for efficient creation and propagation of order. The authors develop an algorithm to compute geodesics exactly for spin chains of any length. Simulation results demonstrate that geodesics can induce order using up to 50% fewer spin-flips than naïve ordering methods. This geodesic approach could provide new techniques for transforming between states in spin systems for quantum technologies.
human_text: Experiments in coherent nuclear and electron magnetic resonance, and opticalspectroscopy correspond to control of quantum mechanical ensembles, guidingthem from initial to final target states by unitary transformations. Thecontrol inputs (pulse sequences) that accomplish these unitary transformationsshould take as little time as possible so as to minimize the effects ofrelaxation and decoherence and to optimize the sensitivity of the experiments.Here we give efficient syntheses of various unitary transformations on Isingspin chains of arbitrary length. The efficient realization of the unitarytransformations presented here is obtained by computing geodesics on a sphereunder a special metric. We show that contrary to the conventional belief, it ispossible to propagate a spin order along an Ising spin chain with couplingstrength J (in units of Hz), significantly faster than 1/(2J) per step. Themethods presented here are expected to be useful for immediate and futureapplications involving control of spin dynamics in coherent spectroscopy andquantum information processing.

direct_prompt: Here is an 8 sentence news article based on the summary:Seren Bundy-Davies Delighted With Women's 4x400m Relay GoldSeren Bundy-Davies led off for Great Britain in the women's 4x400m relay final at the European Championships today. Coming around the final bend in first, the cheers of the home crowd roared as they saw the gold medal was secure. As the teammate crossed the line first, Seren burst into celebration, elation at the victory pouring out. "I'm really delighted we were able to win gold for Great Britain," Seren said afterward. "All of our hard work and training has paid off with this championship title." The women's 4x400m relay win adds to Britain's enormously successful championships campaign on home soil.
human_text: It was Team GB's first European gold in the event since 1969 and their run of three minutes 25.05 seconds was the fastest time in the world this year.Bundy-Davies now hopes to continue her form at the Rio Olympics in August. "I'm hoping I can make that an Olympic medal as well at the end of the year," said the 21-year-old from Wales.Bundy-Davies saw Great Britain home in the final leg in Amsterdam after strong running from team-mates Emily Diamond, Anyika Onuora, Eilidh Doyle. direct_prompt: Here is a 6 sentence abstract for the given article title:We investigate properties of a recursive boson system described by operators acting on the Cuntz algebra ${\cal O}_{\infty}$. The Cuntz algebra provides an ideal framework to represent infinite modes of a quantum harmonic oscillator. We define creation and annihilation operators for each oscillator mode that satisfy the Cuntz relations of the algebra. We examine the action of these operators on Fock space and study properties of the corresponding number operator. The recursive structure of the boson system leads to self-similar behaviour under scale transformations. Our results provide insight into the role of scale invariance and scaling properties for infinite bosonic systems described by the Cuntz algebra.

Abegave a recursive realization of the boson by formal infinite sums of thecanonical generators of the Cuntz algebra ${\cal O}_{\infty}$. In this meaning, we canregard as if the algebra ${\cal B}$ of bosons was a unital $*$-subalgebra of${\cal O}_{\infty}$ on a given permutative representation by keeping theirunboundedness. By this relation, we compute branching laws arising fromrestrictions of representations of ${\cal O}_{\infty}$ on ${\cal B}$. Forexample, it is shown that the Fock representation of ${\cal B}$ is given as therestriction of the standard representation of ${\cal O}_{\infty}$ on ${\calB}$.

[assistant]: The abstract of the academic article "Dark Matter in Gauge Mediation from Emergent Supersymmetry" could be as following:Gauge mediation is a well-motivated mechanism to transmit supersymmetry breaking to the observable sector. However, in most models, gauge mediation suffers from the little hierarchy problem: the messenger fields which mediate the interactions between the supersymmetry breaking sector and the observable sector tend to acquire large masses due to supersymmetry breaking effects. This can lead to unnaturally large contributions to the Higgs mass. In this paper, we propose a solution to the little hierarchy problem in gauge mediation using emergent supersymmetry. Emergent supersymmetry is a new mechanism for supersymmetry breaking which relies on the dynamics of strongly coupled gauge theories. In our model, the messenger fields are charged under a hidden gauge group which is strongly coupled at the messenger mass scale. The strong dynamics of the hidden gauge group generate a large anomalous dimension for the messenger fields, which suppresses their masses. This allows us to solve the little hierarchy problem and obtain a naturally light Higgs mass. We also discuss the phenomenological implications of our model, including the dark matter candidate and the collider signatures.
human_text: We investigated the viability of neutralino dark matter in the gaugemediation from emergent supersymmetry proposal. In this proposal, supersymmetryis broken at Planck scale and consequently, the gravitino is superheavy andcompletely decouples from the low energy theory. Squarks and sleptons obtaintheir soft masses dominantly through gauge mediation with other mechanismshighly suppressed. The lightest supersymmetric partner, in contrast totraditional gauge mediation, is a neutralino which is also a dark mattercandidate. By explicit calculation of the low energy spectra, the parameterspace was constrained using the WMAP observed relic density of dark matter,LEP2 Higgs mass bounds, collider bounds on supersymmetric partners and exoticB-meson decays. We found that the model has intriguing hybrid features such asa nearly gauge-mediated spectrum (the exception being the superheavy gravitino)but with a dominant mSUGRA-like bino-stau coannihilation channel and at large$\tan \beta$, A-resonance-like annihilation.

direct_prompt: Tight binding formulation of the dielectric response in semiconductor nanocrystalsWe present a tight-binding formulation of the dielectric response in semiconductor nanocrystals. The formulation is based on a generalized dielectric constant that takes into account the effects of both the crystal structure and the quantum confinement. We show that the generalized dielectric constant can be used to calculate the optical absorption spectrum of semiconductor nanocrystals. We also show that the generalized dielectric constant can be used to calculate the dielectric constant of semiconductor nanocrystals in an external electric field. Our formulation provides a unified description of the dielectric response of semiconductor nanocrystals that is valid for both the weak and strong confinement regimes. It can be used to calculate the optical properties of semiconductor nanocrystals, as well as their dielectric properties in an external electric field.
human_text: We report on a theoretical derivation of the electronic dielectric responseof semiconductor nanocrystals using a tight-binding framework. Extending to thenanoscale the Hanke and Sham approach [Phys. Rev. B 12, 4501 (1975)] developedfor bulk semiconductors, we show how local field effects can be included in thestudy of confined systems. A great advantage of this scheme is that of beingformulated in terms of localized orbitals and thus it requires very fewcomputational resources and times. Applications to the optical and screeningproperties of semiconductor nanocrystals are presented here and discussed.Results concerning the absorption cross section, the static polarizability andthe screening function of InAs (direct gap) and Si (indirect gap) nanocrystalscompare well to both first principles results and experimental data. We alsoshow that the present scheme allows us to easily go beyond the continuumdielectric model, based on the Clausius-Mossotti equation, which is frequentlyused to include the nanocrystal surface polarization. Our calculations indicatethat the continuum dielectric model, used in conjunction with a size dependentdielectric constant, underestimates the nanocrystal polarizability, leading toexceedingly strong surface polarization fields.

direct_prompt: Abstract:We present the development of a new, three-dimensional, Lagrangian magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code called MAGMA (MHD Applications using a Godunov Method and Adaptive mesh refinement). The primary goal of this project is to model the merger of magnetized neutron stars following their formation in the core collapse of massive stars. Our Godunov-type MHD solver is designed to handle strong shocks, large density and pressure contrasts, and magnetic fields. The integration of the ordinary differential equations is performed using a third-order Runge-Kutta scheme. The code uses a cell-centered finite-volume scheme to solve the MHD equations. The spatial reconstruction of the variables is based on the piecewise parabolic method (PPM). Adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) is used to locally increase the resolution where needed, reducing the computational cost. We describe the numerical methods employed, and discuss the results of a number of one-, two-, and three-dimensional tests. The one- and two-dimensional tests include shock tube problems, the collapse of a magnetized cylinder, the Sedov blast wave, and the Parker instability. These results demonstrate that the code performs well and is capable of accurately capturing the dynamics of MHD flows. Three-dimensional tests of the AMR algorithm are also presented, and we show that significant computational savings can be achieved by using AMR for problems with large spatial dynamic range.
human_text: We present a new, completely Lagrangian magnetohydrodynamics code that isbased on the SPH method. The equations of self-gravitating hydrodynamics arederived self-consistently from a Lagrangian and account for variable smoothinglength (``grad-h''-) terms in both the hydrodynamic and the gravitationalacceleration equations. The evolution of the magnetic field is formulated interms of so-called Euler potentials which are advected with the fluid and thusguarantee the MHD flux-freezing condition. This formulation is equivalent to avector potential approach and therefore fulfills the$\vec{\nabla}\cdot\vec{B}=0$-constraint by construction. Extensive tests inone, two and three dimensions are presented. The tests demonstrate theexcellent conservation properties of the code and show the clear superiority ofthe Euler potentials over earlier magnetic SPH formulations.

direct_prompt: Here is a draft for the abstract:This article reports molecular dynamics simulations of bottle-brush polymers with varying grafting densities and chain lengths. Their conformational properties are characterized and compared to theoretical predictions based on the blob model. The polymers are found to be in a weakly stretched conformation, with a blob size that increases with the grafting density and the chain length. The simulations also show that the bottle-brush polymers form clusters, with the cluster size increasing with the grafting density. The results of this study provide a better understanding of the conformational properties of bottle-brush polymers and their potential applications.
human_text: Scaling predictions and results from self-consistent field calculations forbottle-brush polymers with a rigid backbone and flexible side chains under goodsolvent conditions are summarized and their validity and applicability isassessed by a comparison with Monte Carlo simulations of a simple latticemodel. It is shown that under typical conditions, as they are also present inexperiments, only a rather weak stretching of the side chains is realized, andthen the scaling predictions based on the extension of the Daoud-Cotton blobpicture are not applicable. Also two-component bottle brush polymers are considered, where two types(A,B) of side chains are grafted, assuming that monomers of different kindrepel each other. In this case, variable solvent quality is allowed for, suchthat for poor solvent conditions rather dense cylinder-like structures result.Theories predict ``Janus Cylinder''-type phase separation along the backbone inthis case. The Monte Carlo simulations, using the pruned-enriched Rosenbluthmethod (PERM) then are restricted to rather short side chain length.Nevertheless, evidence is obtained that the phase separation between an A-richpart of the cylindrical molecule and a B-rich part can only occur locally. Thecorrelation length of this microphase separation can be controlled by thesolvent quality. This lack of a phase transition is interpreted by an analogywith models for ferromagnets in one space dimension.
